description_txt: stated on July 7, 2010 in MSNBC's Morning Joe:
quote_txt: The United States accounted for 26 percent of worldwide military spending during the Cold War, but now accounts for 41 percent.

description_txt: stated on June 28, 2010 in a statement on her campaign website:
quote_txt: "We are amassing most of our military strength in a country where fewer than 100 members of al Qaeda remain."

description_txt: stated on August 10, 2010 in a news release:
quote_txt: A bill to aid state and local governments "is fully paid-for by closing costly corporate tax loopholes."

description_txt: stated on August 12, 2010 in an issue statement posted to his website:
quote_txt: Cap and trade legislation that Zack Space supported "would cost the average household approximately $1,761 per year in increased energy rates."

description_txt: stated on July 15, 2010 in a consultant's e-mail to PolitiFact Texas.:
quote_txt: Says Democrat Hank Gilbert "has a criminal conviction for theft, has multiple years of unpaid taxes, has multiple tax liens and fines, unsafe driving convictions (and) has recently been accused of taking a bribe and is on record lying to the press this year about his criminal record."

description_txt: stated on August 6, 2010 in the "Rachel Maddow Show":
quote_txt: "We know that tax cuts are remarkably un-stimulative when you compare them with different kinds of government spending."

description_txt: stated on August 2, 2010 in "The Rachel Maddow Show":
quote_txt: "The overall fact about illegal immigration is that it's not actually getting worse."

description_txt: stated on August 12, 2010:
quote_txt: On whether to eliminate the state income tax.

description_txt: stated on August 5, 2010 in a press release:
quote_txt: Hank Johnson voted against legislation to help "first responders, teachers, vets and troops."

description_txt: stated on August 9, 2010 in a TV interview.:
quote_txt: "The state budget has gone up over 80 percent under Rick Perry."

description_txt: stated on July 31, 2010 in a debate.:
quote_txt: "I've taken on the federal government and won."

description_txt: stated on July 29, 2010 in a campaign commercial:
quote_txt: "The border security plan of Sens. McCain and Kyl called for 3,000 additional troops to keep us safe. President Obama says he'll send 524."

description_txt: stated on August 5, 2010 in a TV ad against John McCain:
quote_txt: McCain opposed the border fence.

description_txt: stated on April 28, 2010 in a speech.:
quote_txt: I've shut down pill mills.

description_txt: stated on July 14, 2010 in a campaign video:
quote_txt: "I’ve even cut my own salary -- twice."

description_txt: stated on July 28, 2010 in a statement:
quote_txt: Exporters are using a federal loophole to "deceptively sell products made from cat and dog fur" to U.S. consumers.

description_txt: stated on August 3, 2010 in a TV ad.:
quote_txt: "Bill McCollum voted for higher taxes and fees 42 times while he was in Congress."

description_txt: stated on August 8, 2010 in ABC's "This Week":
quote_txt: Despite the U.S. spending $10 billion on Iraq's electrical system, Baghdad still only gets five hours of electricity a day.

description_txt: stated on August 8, 2010 in an interview on NBC's 'Meet the Press':
quote_txt: "There's still about $400 billion or $500 billion of the stimulus plan that has not been spent. Why don't we stop it."

description_txt: stated on August 2, 2010 in a campaign video:
quote_txt: "If we ban the practice of earmarks, we could save the American taxpayer anywhere between $15 (billion) to $20 billion dollars a year in pork-barrel spending."

description_txt: stated on August 8, 2010 in an interview on "This Week.":
quote_txt: About 106,000 soldiers had "a prescription of three weeks or more" for pain, depression or anxiety medication.

description_txt: stated on July 14, 2010 in a speech in the U.S. Senate:
quote_txt: "Last year, we borrowed $1.4 trillion -- or 41 cents of every dollar we spent. Over half of this debt is held by foreign investors."

description_txt: stated on June 9, 2010 in an op-ed piece in The Atlanta Journal-Constitution:
quote_txt: "[U]nlike every other major transit system in the nation, MARTA has never received any significant, dedicated funding from the state of Georgia."

description_txt: stated on August 9, 2010 in a conference call with reporters.:
quote_txt: Says the United States is the only nation that affords citizenship to anyone born here, "whether you are here legally or illegally."

description_txt: stated on August 5, 2010 in televised candidates' debate:
quote_txt: "Police officers in this state have that right," to check the immigration status of people they arrest.

description_txt: stated on July 30, 2010 in a statement posted to his website:
quote_txt: "There are currently delays of up to six months in the processing of DNA evidence at the state run crime lab."

description_txt: stated on July 19, 2010 in a Perry website:
quote_txt: Says Bill White "profiteered in the aftermath of Hurricane Rita."

description_txt: stated on July 28, 2010 in a guest column in The Atlanta Journal Constitution:
quote_txt: Allowing all Bush income tax cuts to expire on Dec. 31 "will amount to the largest tax increase in the history of America."

description_txt: stated on July 30, 2010 in a speech in the U.S. House:
quote_txt:
"Over the time that President Obama has been in office, we have lost 2.5 million free
enterprise system jobs, and, yet, 500,000 federal government jobs have been
added."

description_txt: stated on July 27, 2010 in an interview on Fox News' "The Neil Cavuto Show," about U.S. Sen. John Kerry's boat:
quote_txt: Repealing the sales tax on boats in Rhode Island has spawned 2,000 companies, 7,000 jobs and close to $2 billion a year in sales activity.
